content.description: An extension of Insane Whisperings. After the 9th permadraw, continue fighting the pump and traverse 7 more PD's (16 total)...make sure you traverse on the holds below draws. If you traverse holds higher, you are then climbing (Torture-iffic 5.11c). No real 12 crux moves...but fighting pump. Crux is moving past arête and small blank section. After 9 PD you are also out of belayers sight. Have to communicate that your clipping while controlling your breathing and fighting horrible pump.
content.location: Same start as Insane Whisperings. Traverse all the draws.

content.description: According to Hogge guidebook...the grade is height dependent. The crux are the opening moves. 6' and taller and it will feel easier...more like an 11c/d...avg height or shorter and it will feel harder. Using the paper thin undercling and the thin right side pull are key. Get those feet up.
4th variation of Insane Whisperings. Traverse 6 permadraw sand exit up and left to sharp jugs on darker rock. Holds below anchors are dirty.
content.protection: 6 permadraws, 1 bolt, cold shuts for anchors.

content.description: It's a TR set on Icy Touch's anchors. Start between the cracks but don't use the cracks. This is a TR that is just left of the Icy Touch line. It's not bolted...To keep the grade, dont use cracks
content.location: TR line just left of Icy Touch. Share's the same anchors of Icy Touch. Climb Icy Touch first...lower...then climb this route on TR. Fun.

content.description: Another variation of Insane Whisperings.  Start on the right side of the wall, clip the first permadraw and traverse left to the 3rd permadraw.  Then head up to the anchors for Nyarlathotep Arises from the Blackness of 27 Centuries anchors.
content.protection: 3 permadraws, 3 bolts, super shuts for anchors
content.location: Far right of Lovecraftian Madness Wall.  One of the traverse variations.

climbs.name: Nyarlathotep Arises From The Blackness Of 27 Centuries

content.description: This climb shares the start with "Invisible Slayer" but goes straight up instead of traversing left. Pulling the bulge is a wicked crux, but the falls are clean.
content.protection: 5 bolts and 1 fixed draw, supershut anchors.

climbs.name: Invisible Slayer of the Mad Arab Abdul Alhazrad

content.description: This climb is a must do if you climb 5.11. A tricky boulder problem at the start transitions to a leftward traverse. Deadpoint to a good ledge (so much fun!) and then pull your way up through easier climbing.
7th variation of Starspawn. Start very far right of wall, clip first permadraw and traverse to the 4th permadraw and then head up and finish on Invisible Slayer/Fishy Things anchors.
content.protection: 4 permadraws, 2 bolts, super shuts for anchors.
content.location: Very far right of lovecraftian wall. One of the traverse variations.

climbs.name: Insane Whispering from a Yuggothian Braincase

content.description: Start on Icy Touch (as you do for all traverse variations) and head up to first permadraw. Then continue to traverse left until you clip the 9th permadraw. Then lower. This is the main traverse on the wall...the rest are variations off this route. This route is graded an 11b due to it's pump...not necessarily because of technical difficulty. Of all the traverses on lovecraftian...this one seems to get the most traffic
content.location: Start Icy Touch, on right side of Lovecraftian wall below first permadraw.

climbs.name: Icy Touch of a Dimensional Shambler

content.description: Big holds down low gives way to thinner fare up top. Pulling the bulge is the crux and it is quite interesting. The arete is off for this climb.

Start on Insane Whisperings (right under the first Permadraw on the rightside of wall) and traverse left clipping the first 5 permadraws. Then start angling up and left towards the Hideous MI-GO anchors. After the 5 permadraws, you need to clip two bolts before anchors...one bolt being below you and to the left...so bring a long draw or runner to minimize drag.
content.location: Start on Insane Whisperings (as you do for all the traverse variations on Lovecraftian wall). Starts on the Right side of wall and you traverse left midway up the wall, following the permadraws until you exit towards anchors.

content.description: A variation of "Icy Touch of a Dimensional Shambler", this route allows the use of holds on the arete. Beware of an awkward clipping stance that makes for an interesting (yet safe?) fall.

Route is in the middle of the wall. Find the mail slot...line goes up. Starts under roof, get your feet up, hand in mail slot...get left hand up and crank to crimp above first bolt ( crux). Rest of the route is still in the 11 grade.
content.location: There are wooden tablets identifying each route. But route is center of the wall, find the obvious mail slot hold. Route goes directly up.

content.description: This traverse variation will test your endurance! None of the moves are very hard in and of themselves, but keep adding them up and you'll be feeling the burn.

According to guidebook author Hogge, this is best variation at M-Rock. It is stout route, two cruxes. The start and right below the anchors. A Hastur's variation...start as the 11d Hastur route, but at bolt 2, traverse left on Insane Whispering for 2 bolts left, then up permadraw on Fear of Evil Gods.
content.location: Same start as Hastur Semi Liquid Fishy Things.

content.description: Another variation of Insane Whisperings. Traverse to bolt 7 then exit up on Fear of Evil Gods final permadraw and finish to the left. Crux comes after the last clip, big moves and find the monster "thank you" jug.
content.protection: 8 permadraw  sand cold shuts for anchors.
content.location: Traverse Insane Whisperings first 7 bolts, head up to another PD and head up and over to left.

climbs.name: The Dreaded Colour out of Space

content.description: Belay and start on the ledge of the upper ladder. This route is a high traverse of the Lovecraftian wall. It's a blind belay. Traverse high on cliff...clipping upper bolts of other routes on the wall. Do not lead this route unless you are completely crushing 5.7...there is a runout that could end really badly on a fall. Finish on Hideous ME-GO anchors. Easiest travers on wall. Good warmup if you plan on doing all the traverse variations.
content.location: Start left of the upper ladder on ledge. There is a bolt for belayer.

content.description: Climb the low angled start to the big rest ledge, than continue up on the face left of the ladders. Clip anchors next to ladder or use Icy TOuch's anchors.
content.protection: 3 bolts...1 on the low angle wall below and two on the right side of the arete before making move to anchors.
content.location: Farthest line on the right side of Lovecraftian wall.

content.description: Start as same as Icy Touch, clip permadraw and then the first bolt, but instead of clipping bolts above...exit right without using the ledge and clip the two bolts on the right side of the arete. It's another variation route...
content.location: Very far right of Lovecraftian wall.

content.description:
Routes range 5.10b through 5.13. Except for the 10b, all routes have either steep-feet powerful starts, or interesting/cruxy starts.  

  The wall has the funnest traverse in the universe, protected on fixed chains to eliminate cleaning requirements.  Because of its unsual endurance requirements for central Texas, it's challenging for most area climbers up to 5.12, while its lack of power cruxes leaves it workable by 5.10+ climbers.
